member.name: T:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient
member.summary: Represents a FTP session.
member.remarks: Creates a client connection to an FTP server for uploading or downloading files.

member.summary: Raised when file transfer begins.
member.remarks: is local filename, is remote filename, is file transfer direction.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.EndFileTransfer
member.summary: Raised when file transfer completes.
member.remarks: is local filename, is remote filename, is file transfer direction.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.FileTransferProgress
member.summary: Raised as file transfer is progressing.
member.remarks: is current file transfer progress, is file transfer direction.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.FileTransferNotification
member.summary: Raised when ansynchronous file transfer process has completed (success or failure).
member.remarks: is result of asynchronous FTP transfer process.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.ResponseReceived
member.summary: Raised when FTP response has been received.
member.remarks: is received FTP response.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.CommandSent
member.summary: Raised when FTP command has been sent.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.Server
member.summary: Gets or sets FTP server name (DNS name or IP).
member.remarks: FTP server name should not be prefixed with FTP://.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.CaseInsensitive
member.summary: Gets or sets FTP case sensitivity of file and directory names.
member.remarks: Set to true to not be case sensitive with FTP file and directory names.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets FTP server port to use, defaults to 21.
member.remarks: This only needs to be changed if the FTP server is established on a non-standard port number.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout, in milliseconds, for read and write operations, defaults to 30 seconds.

member.summary: Gets or sets the passive/active mode of the server.

member.summary: Gets or sets the IP address to send with the PORT command.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value in the range of ports used when listening for connections in active mode.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpClient.MaxActivePort
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value in the range of ports used when listening for connections in active mode.

member.summary: Gets or sets current FTP session directory.

member.summary: Gets FTP session root directory entry.

member.exception: Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.summary: Closes the FTP stream and releases any resources associated with the stream.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpDataStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpDataStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpDataStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the . This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpDataStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpDataStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpDataStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpDataStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: T:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpFileWatcher
member.summary: FTP File Watcher
member.remarks: Monitors for file changes over an FTP session.

member.summary: Raised when new file is added to monitored FTP directory.
member.remarks: is reference to newly added file.

member.summary: Raised when file is deleted from monitored FTP directory.
member.remarks: is reference to file that was removed.

member.summary: Raised when new status messages come from the FTP file watcher.
member.remarks: is status message from FTP file watcher.

member.summary: Raised when FTP command has been sent.
member.remarks: is sent FTP command.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpFileWatcher.ResponseReceived
member.summary: Raised when FTP response has been received.
member.remarks: is received FTP response.

member.summary: Constructs a new FTP file watcher using the default settings.

member.summary: Constructs a new FTP file watcher using the specified settings.
member.param: Set to true to not be case sensitive with FTP file and directory names.
Set to true to notify after file has completed uploading -or- set to false for immediate notification of new file.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets FTP server name (DNS name or IP) to watch.
member.remarks: FTP server name should not be prefixed with FTP://.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpFileWatcher.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets FTP server port to use, defaults to 21.
member.remarks: This only needs to be changed if the FTP server is established on a non-standard port number.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpFileWatcher.CaseInsensitive
member.summary: Gets or sets FTP case sensitivity of file and directory names.
member.remarks: Set to true to not be case sensitive with FTP file and directory names.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpFileWatcher.WatchInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets interval, in seconds, to scan for file changes on monitored FTP directory.
member.remarks: Specify interval in seconds to poll FTP directory for file changes.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpFileWatcher.Directory
member.summary: Gets or sets name of FTP directory name to monitor. Leave blank to monitor initial FTP session directory.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpFileWatcher.NotifyOnComplete
member.summary: Sets flag for notification time. Set to true to only notify when a file is finished uploading, set to False to get an immediate notification when a new file is detected.

member.summary: Gets or sets enabled state of the object.

member.summary: Returns true if FTP file watcher session is connected.

member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Closes FTP session and clears resources used by the .

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpFileWatcher.Connect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Connects to FTP server and enables file watching if is true.

member.summary: Clones FTP session used by file watcher so it can be used for other purposes.
member.returns: New connected FTP session matching settings defined for FTP file watcher.

member.name: T:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpPath
member.summary: Contains File and Path manipulation methods for FTP communications.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.Ftp.FtpPath.Combine(System.String[])
member.summary: Combines an array of strings into an FTP path.
member.param: An array of parts of the path.
member.returns: The combined paths.
member.exception: One of the strings in the array is null.
member.remarks:
should be an array of the parts of the path to combine. If the one of the subsequent paths is an absolute path, then the combine operation resets starting with that absolute path, discarding all previous combined paths.
Zero-length strings are omitted from the combined path.

member.summary: Gets or sets the passive/active mode of the FTP server.
